Description: Neck and shoulder sherd of Attic black-figured pottery closed vessel, probably a belly amphora; exterior: neck glazed; below, between faint brown bands, incised lotus and palmette chain with added red on hearts of palmettes and calyxes of lotuses; below, top of reserved panel.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Unmarked, found in drawer labelled 'mainly Naukratis.'
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0008) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
